elements.title: East Quoddy Head Lighthouse
elements.contents: ... that there is an East Quoddy Head Lighthouse (pictured) and a West Quoddy Head Lighthouse on opposite sides of a bay, but one is in Canada and the other is in the United States?

elements.title: Dahiru Musdapher
elements.contents: ... that Dahiru Musdapher, the 12th chief justice of Nigeria, was once a BBC World Service contributor for West Africa and Hausa?

elements.title: To Catch a Copper
elements.contents: ... that To Catch a Copper hoped to show "an enjoyable journey of officers solving cases", but discovered "a misconduct process that was unfit for purpose in addressing seriously concerning behaviour"?

elements.title: Karl Schädler
elements.contents: ... that in 1848 Karl Schädler performed the first surgery with chloroform anaesthesia in Liechtenstein?

elements.title: a Texas TV station
elements.contents: ... that the planned sale of a Texas TV station was the subject of a lawsuit more than seven years after it closed for the last time?

elements.title: Bob Born
elements.contents: ... that Bob Born became known as the "Father of Peeps" for automating the production of an Easter marshmallow treat?

elements.title: a Liverpool restaurant
elements.contents: ... that food critic Grace Dent reviewed a Liverpool restaurant that served her rice pudding flavoured with a substance that is banned in the United States for its lethality?

elements.title: Todd Leslie
elements.contents: ... that it took four games for Todd Leslie to set the NCAA Division I record of fifteen consecutive three-point shots made?

elements.title: Young Dirty Bastard
elements.contents: ... that Young Dirty Bastard rapped despite Ol' Dirty Bastard telling him not to?
